page.title: 14NEW SCHOOLS
page.content: The last twenty years have seen great housing developments in Harrogate. These have fortunately been matched in this area with the building of several new primary schools. Only three pre-war buildings are now in use,{Grove Road, New Park}and {Bilton Grange.} In the early 1960's{St. Robert's {School}replaced a much older building in the town centre, and{Woodfield {Infant and Primary Schools}were built to serve a new estate. The 1970's saw the building of{St. {Joseph's R.C. Primary School}and { {Coppice Valley}whilst the old{Bilton {Endowed}was replaced by{Richard Taylor {School.}The last to be built came in the early 1980's with{Saltergate {School} built to serve the estate of that name.
